description: The ship's crew service and maintain the ship's systems and equipment.

count.description: The total number of crew members on the ship.

min.description: The minimum number of crew members required to maintain the ship.

max.description: The maximum number of crew members the ship can support.

rotation.description: The rotation of crew shifts. A stricter shift improves the ship's performance. A more relaxed shift improves the crew's morale.

morale.description: A rough measure of the crew's morale. A higher morale means the crew is happier and more productive. A lower morale means the ship is more prone to accidents.

wages.description: The amount of credits per crew member paid per minute of time travelled between waypoints. Wages are paid when a ship departs from a waypoint.
